item.title: Dice Dreams: Free Rolls For November 2024 (Updated Daily)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Dice Dreams Links For November 2024
  • How To Redeem Dice Links In Dice Dreams

From attacking opponents and collecting resources to upgrading your kingdom, Dice Dreams is a great option for everyone who enjoys board games with a competitive twist. As the name implies, the core mechanic of Dice Dreams revolves around rolling dice to determine movement and actions on the board.

If you feel like your dice supply is running low, you can use dice links to get free rolls in Dice Dreams . With these free rolls, you can continue rolling the dice to build your kingdom, collect resources, and compete with other players to become the true Dice King.

Updated November 11, 2024, by Usama Ali: Put simply, if you want to make progress in Dice Dreams, you need a lot of dice. With each roll, you can either build up your kingdom with the coins you collect or raid other players' boards for treasure. Running out of dice in Dice Dreams means you can't take any actions on the board. Thankfully, Dice Dreams frequently releases free dice links. You can use these links to top up your dice pool and keep the fun going. This guide is updated regularly with new Dice Dreams links to help you keep your dice rolling. Remember, these links are only active for a short time, so check back often to claim your rewards before they expire.

We added a new link today.

Dice Dreams Links For November 2024

Like most board games, the developers of Dice Dreams regularly introduce dice links for players running low on dice. These links can be helpful in continuing your progress and can be used to redeem various rewards, including rolls and Building Blitz, which can consequently help you build your kingdom. Moreover, these links occasionally reward millions of coins, but most of the time, you'll receive rolls. Below is a list of active links that Dice Dreams players can use to earn some free goodies.

These links are only active for a limited time period, so make sure to redeem them before they expire.

In addition to redeeming rewards from these links, you can earn rolls in Dice Dreams through various other methods. These include regularly participating in events, inviting friends to the game, and taking advantage of in-game promotions and offers. While spending real money is not recommended, you can invite new players or link your Facebook account to get rolls for free.

Expired Dice Dream Links

Like most mobile games, Dice Dreams links expire quickly, usually within a day or so. Recently, there’s been a noticeable shift in the frequency of these link releases, and developers have reduced their quantity. As such, it’s uncertain how long the links will remain active moving forward. For your convenience, here are some expired Dice Dreams links:

How To Redeem Dice Links In Dice Dreams

To redeem a link in Dice Dreams for its reward, you'll first have to click on the links mentioned above. These links will redirect you to another page where you'll see "Get." Click on that, and you'll be redirected to your game, where you'll receive the respective rewards instantly.

You need to have the Dice Dreams app installed before clicking on the link, or else the links and "Get" button will not work.

Make sure to only click on dice links from trustworthy sources to avoid malware or data leakage issues. The links included here have been tried and tested to ensure players don't run into any problems.

Dice Dreams is now available for Android and iOS.

item.title: Why PS5 Players Should Keep an Open Mind About Fairgames
item.description:
In July 2022, PlayStation acquired Haven Studios, a Canadian game developer situated in Montreal, Quebec. Haven Studios' name likely didn't ring any bells for most gamers, but that's because it had never released a game at the time. In fact, the studio was established in March 2021, only a year before it was bought by PlayStation owner Sony. Even though Haven Studios was brand-new, it had a lot of talented developers at the helm; the company was founded by Assassin's Creed and Watch Dogs co-creator Jade Raymond, who was previously employed at Ubisoft, EA, and Stadia. Additionally, more than a hundred employees were working at Haven Studios as of 2022, many of whom were experienced creators behind hit titles like Rainbow Six: Siege .

Sony confirmed that Haven Studios was working on a new live service game shortly after it purchased the firm, but it didn't reveal what that game was until 2023. During the PlayStation Showcase that year, the two companies announced Fairgames , a co-op heist shooter developed exclusively for PS5 and PC. Fairgames was met with largely lukewarm reception among PlayStation fans upon its announcement. Many were critical of the lack of gameplay in its vague, CGI-focused reveal trailer, and others were quick to label the game as a derivative Payday clone, despite not seeing much of it. Haven Studio's debut project admittedly didn't make a great first impression, but there's still a chance that the game may end up being a hit, especially after some recent developments at Sony.

Fairgames Could End Up Being Better than Some Gamers Expect

Fairgames is One of Several Live Service Games in Development at Sony

Sony is typically known for its blockbuster singleplayer games, but the company has been trying to break into the fruitful live service market over the last few years. Fairgames was just one of several titles that the PlayStation owner invested in as part of this initiative, alongside other games like Bungie's Marathon and Naughty Dog's now-canceled The Last of Us: Online . After the failure of the PlayStation first-party hero shooter Concord , though, some pundits believed that Sony would pivot away from its live service push entirely. However, according to Sony CFO Hiroki Totoki, this won't be the case.

Sony is Learning a Lot from Its Recent LIve Service Releases

During a recent meeting with shareholders, Totoki revealed that PlayStation would continue making live service games alongside traditional singleplayer titles. He then added that PlayStation would hold more internal tests going forward in order to prevent a disaster like Concord from happening again. Totoki also stated that Sony learned a lot from the GAAS games it released this year. According to him, the company "intends to share the lessons learned from its successes and failures" across the many studios it owns "so as to strengthen its development management system."

Sony released two live service games this year: Arrowhead Game Studios' Helldivers 2 and Firewalk Studios' Concord . The former was a massive success, while the latter was the exact opposite.

Sony's Plans to Improve Its Future Live Service Titles Will Likely Benefit Fairgames

The fact that Sony is determined to make its future live service games successful may bode well for Fairgames . If PlayStation does indeed learn from its mistakes, as Totoki says, then it's unlikely that the company will release Haven Studio's upcoming co-op shooter without it reaching a certain quality bar. The QA tests Sony plans to put in place for its future GAAS games may benefit Fairgames a lot. Not only will they potentially improve the quality of the game as a whole, but they may also allow it to be as rich in content as possible upon its launch.

It's unclear exactly how Fairgames will play or when it will even release, but a recent rumor alleged that Sony was very positive about Fairgames internally. Hopefully, this report is true, because if Fairgames is high-quality and able to distinguish itself from its competitors in meaningful ways, then it may attract a large audience on PlayStation consoles and PC.

item.title: Overwatch 2 - Overwatch: Classic Official Trailer
item.description: Overwatch 2 adds a limited time mode called Overwatch: Classic, which brings back 6v6 matches, the original hero roster, and classic abilities. The event also sees the return of original maps like Hanamura, Temple of Anubis, and Volskaya Industries.

item.title: Future DC Games May Be Stuck Between a Rock and a Hard Place
item.description:
After recent releases have failed to impress audiences, Warner Bros. has revealed that it is going to be shifting focus a bit. Instead of developing titles in all of its vast IP, the studio has plans to put more of an emphasis on four franchises: Mortal Kombat, DC Comics, Harry Potter , and Game of Thrones . With DC Comics, the studio wants to specifically focus on Batman and his exciting roster of supporting characters. Although that could lead to something special, it may not be the best route forward.

Just like with Marvel, DC has made a name for itself with its massive cast of characters. Players have fallen in love with Wonder Woman, The Flash, Green Lantern, and all the rest of DC's leading figures. However, the immense success of Batman has eclipsed them all, so naturally, the studio wants to focus on his story more than all the others. And while that has led to some fantastic titles over the years, putting too much of a focus on him may put DC's future in a tough spot.

DC"s Focus on Batman May Not Be a Great Way Forward

The Arkham Series is Currently in a Rough Spot

One of the main reasons that focusing on Batman may not be the best idea is that his video game life seems to be in a rough state right now. While the LEGO Batman franchise has gone from hit to hit, the Batman: Arkham series has not had as much luck recently. The original Arkham trilogy helped define what a great superhero video game should be, but since Arkham Knight , the series has struggled to make the same impact.

Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League was supposed to be the next massive Rocksteady-led adventure in this series, yet it failed to deliver. The focus on live-service proved extremely controversial, the story felt lackluster for many, and the entire experience paled in comparison to what came before. Additionally, the story's use of the Caped Crusader left a sour taste in the mouths of many.

Outside of Suicide Squad , the other Arkham games after the main trilogy have also struggled to impress audiences. 2013's Batman: Arkham Origins and Batman: Arkham VR were met with mixed reception, and Batman: Arkham Shadow has seemingly come and gone despite good reviews. While another mainline Batman: Arkham game could be worth a try, if it continues the franchise's recent trend, it could also further dampen it for many.

Too Many Batman Experiences May Burn Players Out

Of course, Warner Bros. does not just have to stick with the Batman: Arkham series, as superheroes are rebooted all the time. There are still plenty of stories waiting to be told and gameplay styles waiting to be tapped, so the potential for a Batman-led adventure in another style is seemingly limitless. However, the moment might be right to move away from Batman altogether, despite Warner Bros.' plans.

Batman has been the face of the DC brand for years, as he is its most profitable hero. He has seen countless movies and appeared in many video games these last couple of years. As of now, there are even two live-action series with The Dark Knight being built, and his most famous villain has just got a brand-new standalone film in the form of Joker: Folie a Deux . Fans do not have to look far for any sort of Batman content, which is great, but if video games also continue to focus on him, then those same fans may quickly get burnt out.

Warner Bros. is at risk of having too much of a good thing on its hands by focusing on Batman. DC is filled to the brim with characters that could shine in their own video games. If Batman is the only thing fans are getting, then those experiences will not feel as special anymore. Yet, if there are other heroes' stories between whatever Bruce Wayne does next, then that could be the perfect way to build anticipation. Hopefully that's exactly what will happen, but based on what Warner Bros. has said, it may be a long time before players get anything besides Batman.

item.title: 18 Best Party Games on PS5, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • PS5 features a fantastic collection of party games that reinvent social gaming and create friendly rivalries.
  • Innovative developers are creating unique party games that encourage cooperation or competition among players.
  • Party games like Escape Game Fort Boyard, Table Game Deluxe Pack, and Stumble Guys offer thrilling and immersive experiences.

Every gamer secretly hopes their living room will be transformed into a place of joyous fellowship and indelible memories, and that hope was granted with the release of the PlayStation 5 . The PS5 has a great collection of party games that reinvent social gaming and go beyond the system's stunning visuals and solo adventures.

The PlayStation 5 continues to revolutionize the gaming industry, and with it comes an incredible selection of party games that are sure to inspire friendly rivalries and provide plenty of opportunities for fun. These games are the perfect ingredient for energizing get-togethers, as they can range from friendly adventures that push the limits of teamwork to heart-pounding showdowns. The best PS5 party games show players the way to an infinite world of enjoyment.

Updated November 11, 2024, by Mehrdad Khayyat: Finding a good game to play with friends or family may require a lot of trial and error, as most triple-A games are online-only nowadays and barely support local multiplayer.

That being said, there are still innovative developers who come up with great ideas to gather gamers together over a single console just like in the good old days. Games that either encourage players to cooperate in difficult situations or put them against each other.

18 Escape Game Fort Boyard

Complete Various Challenges And Puzzles To Escape A Fort

  • Released: June 25, 2020
  • Developer: Appeal Studios
  • Platforms: PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch

Players need look no further than Escape Game - Fort Boyard if they are looking for a party game that combines thrilling difficulties with collaboration. This PlayStation 5 treasure takes players to the famous Fort Boyard, where teamwork and rapid reasoning are essential. Each team must work together to solve challenging puzzles and overcome physical hurdles as they race against the clock.

The varied obstacles call for coordination, making it a great activity for get-togethers. The Escape Game - Fort Boyard ranks high among the finest party games because of the amazing mix of thrill and friendship it provides through its immersive gameplay and competitive spirit.

17 The Table Game Deluxe Pack

Play A Litany Of Popular Games Virtually

  • Released: January 26, 2023
  • Developer: Office5656 Co., Ltd.
  • Platforms: PlayStation 4, Xbox One, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S

The Table Game Deluxe Pack stands out among PS5 party games due to its innovative combination of traditional board games with modern digital enhancements. Popular games like chess, poker, and mahjong are given a new lease on life with breathtaking graphics and simple controls in this collection. Virtual chess tournaments between friends allow for intense mental duels without leaving the couch.

Meanwhile, those interested in playing Poker can do so in a virtual setting. Mahjong's inclusion broadens the scope of possible cultures represented. With its user-friendliness, variety of games, and polished multiplayer, The Table Game Deluxe Pack is a strong contender for the crown of the greatest PS5 party games, promising countless hours of nostalgic fun.

16 Stumble Guys

A Party Game In The Same Vein As Fall Guys

Fall Guys is one of the most popular party games players can get their hands on, with the game feeling like a virtual version of Takeshi's Castle . The popularity of this game is so immense that most players are bound to have played through the numerous game modes time and time again. Players looking for a change while also seeking out the best PS5 party games like Fall Guys will find a similarly-titled product to be right up their alley.

Stumble Guys wears its inspiration on its sleeve, channeling Fall Guys in all but name. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, and some may argue that the game places more of an emphasis on skill as opposed to Fall Guys . Thankfully, there's an element of luck involved in this title to ensure that newcomers make substantial progress too.

15 Gang Beasts

A Brawling Party Game With Unwieldy Characters

Gang Beasts , one of the best party games for the PS5 , is a title where players can cause some serious havoc. Every fight in this unusual brawler is a hilarious show thanks to the combination of unique characters and physics-based pandemonium. The player controls gelatinous avatars in combat, which takes place in various surreal settings.

People can get inventive with the many methods of enemy elimination by clinging to ledges, tossing them over buildings, and employing other such creative methods. Because of its simple controls and unique mix of skill and humor, Gang Beasts is an indispensable addition to any group gaming night. A group of friends will be in for moments of pure humor that will stay with them forever as they participate in gelatinous combat.

14 Just Dance 2024 Edition

Another Excellent Entry In A Popular Dancing Series Perfect For Parties

Players must be ready to shake it like never before with Just Dance 2024 Edition . This latest installment of the popular series is more than just a game. It's a dance spectacular that encourages players to let their inner dancing divas and dazzling dancers shine. This game features an extensive soundtrack of catchy melodies spanning genres and eras, from current hits to oldies, setting the mood for a musical duel unlike any other.

Players can feel the rhythm and break it down in an exciting dance-off that goes beyond the confines of the screen. Take hold of the controls and get ready to let loose to some seriously cool music and choreography in Just Dance 2024 Edition .

13 PlateUp!

A Fresh Take On Overcooked's Gameplay Loop With A Roguelite Twist

Players who love the hilarious confusion of Overcooked and want things to be spruced up further will love what PlateUp! brings to the table. At a glance, this may seem like a carbon copy of one of the most successful co-op party games of all time, but PlateUp! has a ton of interesting ideas it throws at the wall, and a lot of them do end up sticking.

Building a restaurant from scratch, decorating it to their heart's content, and serving customers without skipping a beat is what makes PlateUp! such a brilliant title to play through. There's a method to the madness in this title that makes every session of PlateUp! a blast to play through once players understand how its mechanics synchronize with each other to make for a wonderful title that never lets up.

12 Moving Out

Help People Move Out And Stack Objects In Trucks While Adhering To A Time Limit

By turning the mundane task of moving into a hilarious and thrilling multiplayer adventure, Moving Out has cemented its place as one of the best PS5 party games . In this physics-based environment, friends will have to work together to accomplish various goals while dealing with an abundance of hilarious obstacles.

Together, players can create a symphony of chaos and hilarity as they strategize and coordinate their actions in this game. Moving Out is a must-have for any gaming get-together because of its user-friendly controls and randomly generated settings, which may lead to both hilarious and embarrassing experiences for everyone involved.

11 Boomerang Fu

A Cute Multiplayer Action Game Perfect For Parties

A simple party game where players control cute everyday foodstuffs and other objects that battle it out to the death with deadly boomerangs, Boomerang Fu 's appeal is undeniable. The game is a blast to play through, with new players easily getting a hang of things.

Slicing and dicing through opponents to get the best score is addictive. The powers in this game also do a great job of making the experience feel fresh, and players on a losing streak can easily mount a comeback with a generous Shield that is automatically gifted to them.

10 The Jackbox Party Pack Series

A Collection Of Riveting Party Games

The Jackbox Party Pack series ushers in a new era of socially interactive entertainment. This collection is bursting at the seams with innovative games that take advantage of cellphones as controllers to make trivia, drawing, and wordplay accessible to everyone. Its clever simplicity in design makes gaming accessible to more people without the need for expensive peripherals.

The game's subtle comedy quickly becomes the talk of the party as players of all ages and skill levels join in on the fun. The Jackbox Party Pack Series is an appealing cornerstone of every spectacular PS5 gaming party. Also, its ever-expanding library of party games stands as a dazzling tribute to the power of networking.

9 Among Us

A Multiplayer Whodunit That Has Become A Social Phenomenon And One Of The Best Party Games

Among Us exploded in popularity during the pandemic and continues to be the most engaging social multiplayer whodunit players can check out. The endearing visuals, soft sci-fi setting, and intriguing gameplay loop ensure that this game will remain relevant as one of the best PS5 party games .

Players can step into a lobby and engage in some wholesome murders as they try to locate and evict the impostors who are slowly whittling down the crew one by one. Failing to eject the proper character can be a disaster for the crewmates, who must be astute about their observations to ensure that the villains don't emerge victorious.

8 Fall Guys: Ultimate Knockout

A Playable Form Of Takeshi's Castle That Makes It A Perfect Fit For Parties

Players who want to play a video game version of Takeshi's Castle will find Fall Guys to be the perfect title for them. It functions as a game show where players must overcome numerous challenges to reach the final level and attain victory against all odds.

The addictive gameplay and endearing visuals of Fall Guys make it an easy recommendation for players who want to enjoy a fun party game. Two players can play at a time, making it a great time at a party where players take turns trying to reach the very top of the pile.

7 Worms Armageddon: Anniversary Edition

An Old-School Turn-Based PvP Game Using Environment Destruction

Worms is one of the classic multiplayer video game series that used to be so much popular back then, when split-screen games were still topping the charts. It's a PvP experience that revolves around a destructible world. Each player will begin the game as a worm, and will use a variety of weapons to either kill the opponent or ruin their positioning.

Targeting the opponents precisely is quite difficult, which is the main reason why playing Worms Armageddon is fun, and the fate of the battle is almost unpredictable at all times, no matter how critical a player's position is.

6 Sackboy: A Big Adventure

A Fun Platforming Game That Can Be Whipped Out At Parties

Sackboy: A Big Adventure 's innovative gameplay and cooperative elements set it apart from other games. This charming platformer takes up to four players through colorful landscapes with challenging and original stages. The success of the game depends on the players' ability to work together to overcome difficult situations that call for well-coordinated actions and smart thinking.

In addition to the game's core features, Sackboy : A Big Adventure allows players to give their lovable protagonists a unique touch by dressing them in a wide range of colorful outfits. By deftly blending inventiveness with orderly chaos, Sackboy: A Big Adventure ensures that every guest will have a memorable and enjoyable time at the party.

5 Rubber Bandits

A Chaotic Party Game Focused On Looting With Comedic, Hard-To-Control Characters

A huge part of what makes party games such a joy to play through is the sheer chaos that can ensue in each round, ensuring that a group of players have a great time messing about without fiddling too much with the controls. This is precisely what makes Rubber Bandits a blast to play through and worth checking out for any fan of unique party games.

The title wastes no time in dropping players into multiple rounds of sheer hilarity as players try to loot as much as possible while debilitating other players along the way. Featuring a wealth of interesting game modes, it's easy to see why Rubber Bandits has burst onto the scene as one of the best modern party games players can get their hands on.

4 Beat Saber

One Of The Most Popular VR Rhythm Games Perfect For Parties

There's a reason why a lot of VR headsets have turned into glorified Beat Saber machines. It's one of the most popular games on this platform that fans can't get enough of to this day. There's something about timing one's sword swings with the beat and getting the highest score on an intense song that makes Beat Saber so much fun to play through.

Beat Saber cannot be played without a VR headset.

It's one of the best PS5 party games for people who have a PSVR headset. Watching a friend struggle to hit blocks and flailing their arms around makes for a great time that can add that extra spice to a successful party. The game has a variety of difficulty options to ensure that players with varying skills can enjoy the game without getting too frustrated after losing repeatedly.

3 Keep Talking And Nobody Explodes

Neutralize A Bomb Threat By Just Describing It To The Player In Charge

Keep Talking And Nobody Explodes is all about disarming a bomb, but with a fun twist. Only one player has access to the bomb and can actually see it, and they are the only player with no knowledge about how to disarm it.

On the other hand, a set of other players do have an instruction in hand for disarming the bomb, but since they can't see the bomb, they need to communicate with the player in charge of disarming to finally survive the threat before the timer hits zero.

2 Human Fall Flat

Overcome The Physics Simulation And Cooperate To Tackle Objectives

Human Fall Flat is a physics-based game with a variety of scenarios that will make players laugh more than they could actually complete the objectives. During each scenario, players will have to cooperate with each other to get past a difficult platforming puzzle or place certain things at designated spots.

Of course, it's easier said than done. It will take a bit until players get the hang of controls for the character, but even after that, the goofy movement mechanics of Human Fall Flat will deeply challenge players with tackling the objectives, creating a lot of funny moments in between.

1 Overcooked! All You Can Eat

A Legendary Duology Of Party Games Where Players Band Together To Prepare And Serve Orders

Overcooked is the first game that comes to mind when players talk about party games that are a lot of fun to play through. It doesn't take a genius to understand Overcooked 's mechanics, making it the perfect pick-up-and-play title that players will love as they try to make dishes and satisfy as many customers as possible.

What makes this simple gameplay loop so satisfying is the incredible presentation of each stage, with a wealth of hazards and unique dish combinations meaning that players have to constantly be on their toes in every level. Overcooked can either be the life of the party or cause serious arguments to break out — there's no in-between, and this is precisely why so many people hail this title as one of the best modern party games ever made.
